You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Storefront General Settings

Set important names, domains, search metadata, behavioral flags, and other baseline values for the storefront.

REQUIRED EDITIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
Storefront Info
Name
Name of the storefront that appears throughout the org, such as DefaultStore.
TIP To change the storefront name, go to the Storefronts page in Global Settings, and click Edit.
Customer Portal Account Group Name
Name of the account group that B2B Commerce for Visualforce automatically assigns to buyers who self-register on your storefront. By default, this account group is PortalAccount, but you can specify a different account group.
Customer Portal Account Name
Name of the account that’s associated with the customer portal account group.
Root Category ID
ID of the CC Category record in your org that’s the top parent for all the categories you want to show on the storefront. B2B Commerce for Visualforce uses the root category to determine the hierarchy of categories that comprise the storefront’s category tree.
SF Server URL
NOTE No longer used in the managed package.
Site Secure Domain
The secure domain name that handles authenticated traffic through your storefront. This value is the domain name for your storefront's Experience Cloud site in your org, which you create when you enable Digital Experiences for storefronts, prefixed with the https:// protocol.
Site Unsecure Domain
NOTE No longer used in the managed package. In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) or later, this field is removed.
Valid Prices Date
The date and time that you set prices on the storefront. B2B Commerce for Visualforce compares this value against the Repriced Date value on the cart to determine whether to reprice items in the cart.
TIP Make sure that you also set the Optimize Cart Repricing setting of the Cart configuration module in CC Admin to expired or dailyorexpired.
Order Confirmation Email Template
The name of a Salesforce email template to use for confirmation emails sent to users after placing an order.
Order Confirmation cc Address
An email address to CC on all order confirmation emails.
E Commerce Type
To avoid confusion, we recommend that you leave the default value, B2B.
SEO

To help search engines gather information about your storefront, specify search engine optimization (SEO) metadata for the storefront. B2B Commerce for Visualforce publishes these values in <meta> tags in the <head> of certain storefront pages.

Catalog Search Ranking

Adjust the relative weight of certain criteria when ranking results from a storefront search.

Chat Widget

These options are deprecated and no longer supported in the managed package.

Storefront Flags

Enable or disable certain storefront behaviors.

Developer Mode
Output debugging information to the browser console with the CCRZ.console JavaScript object.
Display Page Label Names
Show the names of page label records on the storefront instead of their values.
Allow Anonymous Checkout
Grant guest users permission for completing checkout without having to register.
TIP When you turn on this flag, also enable guest user access for the appropriate Visualforce pages and custom objects. For more information, see Allow a B2B Commerce for Visualforce Guest Buyer to Check Out.
InventoryCheckFlag
Show a specific quantity that's available for a product on the Product Detail page. See Manage Product Inventory Items and Availability Messages.
Skip Tax Calculation
Hide tax fields on the Checkout page, and don’t calculate tax costs for an order. The ccrz.cc_hk_TaxCalculation.skipTaxCalculation extension point method evaluates this field.
Automatically Calculate Price Adjustment
Call the ccrz.cc_api_PriceAdjustment extension point class in the B2B Commerce for Visualforce API when loading the Shopping Cart page. If this flag is disabled, B2B Commerce for Visualforce waits to call the price adjustment extension until the user applies discounts on the Shopping Cart page.
Quoting Enabled
This option is deprecated and no longer affects any functionality in the managed package. For information about allowing a buyer to request a quote for items in the cart, see Allow a Buyer to Request a Quote for the Contents of the Shopping Cart.
Send Confirmation Email
Email the user after they place an order. For information about required permissions and other considerations for sending the email, see Show Order Confirmation Details and Send Order Emails.
Hide My Account Profile Edit
Prevent a registered user from being able to edit their profile on the My Account page. See Show Account, Contact, and User Information on the My Account Page.
Display Coupon on Cart
Allow a user to enter a discount code on the shopping cart page. See Show Coupon Information on the Shopping Cart Page.
Skip Shipping Calculation
Hide the estimated shipping cost on the Order Review section of the Checkout page, and don’t include shipping cost in the cart total. See Show Fees and Charges in the Order Review Section of the Checkout Page.
Filter Orders Based on Owner
In the My Orders section of the My Account page, show only the orders the logged-in user is the owner for. If this flag is turned off, all orders the user is entitled to view are available in My Orders. The list of orders then includes an Owner column that shows the owner name.
Base Price Lists

Specify the base price list for products on your storefront. If your storefront supports multiple currencies, specify a base price list for each currency.

Price List Name
Exact name of the CC Price List record you want to specify as the base price list.
Currency ISO Code
Currency ISO code, such as USD, for the base price list.
